title.narrative: G4AW Satellite4Business, Ghana

description.narrative:
**Sat4Business will support over 140.000 Ghanaian cocoa and palm-oil farmers to increase their food production, income, and job creation with the establishment of Sat4Business information products and credit support services. Farmers will receive information on market prices, weather, agricultural and agronomic tips, as well as get access to financial services such as pensions, insurances, and loans.**
Ghana is the world’s 2nd largest producer of cocoa globally. The Sat4Business project area constitutes about 90% of cocoa produced in Ghana (COCOBOD, 2015/16 production data) and accounts for about 86% of oil palm planted in the country. This is an indication of favourable climatic conditions for these crops, and how relevant improving the productivity in these regions will positively influence the national production levels.
Agricultural advise, market information, and access to finance provided to cocoa and palm-oil farmers in Ghana

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Food and Agriculture Ghana
Ministry of Food and Agriculture Ghana

mailing-address.narrative: Nii Sai Road, East Legon, Accra

description.narrative: payment upon termination of the programme

title.narrative: G4AW website by Netherlands Space Office (NSO)
Satellite4Business
Reach: Number of food producers that have become familiar with the services provided within the project (direct training + indirect education)
1a) Total number of food producers that have been reached by services provided within the project

description.narrative: Number of food producers that have received direct and indirect education (via services provided within the project). Same as indicator 5a.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: This number of food producers were profiled for credit scoring in year 1 of the project. The first year involved a pilot of nearly 5000 farmers. The next year will compensate for the gap compared to the targeted number of farmers.

title.narrative: Secondary target groups reached outside direct food producers (such as B2B, B2G)
2b) Total users/stakeholders of other target groups that have been reached by services provided within the project - FSPs

description.narrative: Number of FSPs that enroll to the platform.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: In the first project year, there are no financial service providers that officially onboarded to the platform. However, Advans has expressed interest and contributed $7,500 as commitment, and an Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) is expected to be signed in year 2 of the project.

title.narrative: 2a) Total users/stakeholders of other target groups that have been reached by services provided within the project - service providers (SMEs)

description.narrative: Number of SMEs that have received direct and indirect education and/or training. Direct = Call centre and SMS. Indirect = Radio and directly reached farmers.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: No SME was engaged in year 1 of the project. Plans are underway to enrol 12 SMEs onto the platform in year 2 of the project. These SMEs will be trained on how to access and use the service platform to provide various input, farm management, marketing, extension, storage and ICT services, among others, to the farmers onboarded to the platform.

title.narrative: Sustainable food production
10) Cocoa: Improvement of food production (crop yield increase in kg/ha and %) as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.

description.narrative: % yield increase in kg/ha (cocoa)

title.narrative: 10) Oil palm: Improvement of food production (crop yield increase in kg/ha and %) as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.

description.narrative: % yield increase in kg/ha (oil palm)

title.narrative: 9abc) Number of food producers with improved food production as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project − Total

description.narrative: Number of food producers with improved food production as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project. The % from the sample will represent the population. Base the number value on that.

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: This is zero (0) because the intervention does not exist during baseline

title.narrative: USE OF SERVICE: Service 1 - GIS data provided by Satelligence to service providers
37) Number of entities using the platform

description.narrative: Number of SMEs and financial institutions that use the platform to provide services to famers.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: Indicator changed with approval from NSO. Changed (from: ‘Total number of individual subscriptions (1st order users)') to: ‘Number of entities using the platform’. No SME or FSP has been officially onboarded onto the platform. Advans has expressed interest and contributed $7,500 as committment. An MOU is expected to be signed in year 2 of the project.

title.narrative: 38) Area of agricultural land possessed by the reached food producers using the service(s)

description.narrative: The average of the directly reached farmers applied as average to the indirectly reached farmers.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: This refers to the area of agricultural land possessed by the 4,818 profiled food producers (both cocoa and oil palm farmers).

title.narrative: 39) Number of individual service providers subscriptions in the last 12 months that continued to use the service(s) in the reporting period. Sustainable use for multiple years.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: No service provider was enrolled in year 1. The program seeks to onboard service providers in year 2.

title.narrative: USE OF SERVICE: Service 3 - Registered on Platform
43) Total number of individual subscriptions

description.narrative: Number of farmers that are registered on the platform

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: These farmers have received profiling services (from SWA) and credit scoring services (from Financial Access).

title.narrative: 44) Area of agricultural land possessed by the reached food producers using the service(s)

description.narrative: The average of the directly reached farmers applied as average to the indirectly reached farmers.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: This refers to the area of agricultural land possessed by the 4,818 profiled food producers.

title.narrative: 45) Number of individual food producer subscriptions in the last 12 months that continued to use the service(s) in the reporting period. Sustainable use for multiple years.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: All 4,818 profiled food producers are suscribed to the credit scoring services.

title.narrative: USE OF SERVICE: Service 4 - Radio, SMS, Call center campaign
47) Area of agricultural land possessed* by the reached food producers using the service(s)

description.narrative: Number of farmers that are registered on the platform.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: This refers to the land size of the 4,818 farmers profiled in year 1.

title.narrative: 48) Number of individual food producer subscriptions in the last 12 months that continued to use the service(s) in the reporting period. Sustainable use for multiple years.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: All 4,818 profiled food producers are suscribed to the credit scoring services.

title.narrative: USE OF SERVICE: Service 2 - Farmers serviced with farmer improvement advice and credit scores
40) Total number of individual subscriptions (1st order users)

description.narrative:
Number of farmers that benefit from the platform.
Counting the number of farmers who receive financial or information services from the joint venture platform.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: These farmers have received profiling services (from SWA) and credit scoring services (from Financial Access) in year 1.

title.narrative: 41) Area of agricultural land possessed by the reached food producers using the service(s)

description.narrative: The average of the directly reached farmers applied as average to the indirectly reached farmers.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: This refers to the area of agricultural land possessed by the 4,818 profiled food producers.

title.narrative: 42) Number of individual food producer subscriptions in the last 12 months that continued to use the service(s) in the reporting period. Sustainable use for multiple years.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: These farmers have received profiling services (from SWA) and credit scoring services (from Financial Access).

title.narrative: USE OF SERVICE: Actual use of the services
6abc) Number of individual food producer subscriptions in the last 12 months that continued to use the service(s) in the reporting period. Sustainable use for multiple years.

description.narrative:
Number of farmers who received at least 70% of the Call centre calls.
For every Call centre call deployed, a report is generated, so the number of calls that farmers have received is known. (listenership). By using the services is meant using 1 or more of the following: 1) Farmers listen to Call centre calls (at least 70% of the Call centre calls). 2) Farmers have a subscription (through Esoko system) to receiving SMS messages. 3) Listening to radio programmes. The radio station will have listenership reports (number of people that tuned into a frequency at a certain time).

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: These farmers have received profiling services (from Solidaridad West Africa) and credit scoring services (from Financial Access) in the first project year.

title.narrative: 5abc) Total number of individual food producers having a subscription to one or multiple service(s) provided within the project (1st order users)

description.narrative: Number of food producers that have received direct and indirect education (via services provided within the project). (same as indicator 1a)

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: These farmers have received profiling services (from Solidaridad West Africa) and credit scoring services (from Financial access) in the first project year.

title.narrative: 7) Area of agricultural land possessed by the reached food producers using the service(s)

description.narrative: Number of ha of agricultural land possessed by (direct) farmers that use the services (Call centre, SMS, radio).

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: This refers to the area of agricultural land possessed by the 4,818 profiled food producers (cocoa and oil palm farmers).

title.narrative: Training and education: Number of food producers that have been trained and educated about the project service(s)
3abc) Total number of people that have received direct training or education within the project

description.narrative: Number of food producers that have received direct education (via services provided within the project). Direct = Call centre and SMS.

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: This is the number of food producers that received training via the Esoko call centre. These food producers received introductory Sat4Business messages, and introductory messages on Good Agronomic Practices (Cocoa) and Best Management Practices (Oil palm).

title.narrative: 4a) Total number of people that have received indirect training or education within the project.

description.narrative: Number of food producers that have received indirect education (via services provided within the project).

comment.narrative: 11-09-2020: No indirect training was provided in the first project year. Indirect beneficiaries will be targeted in year 2 and year 3. The project plans to reach about 50,000 indirect beneficiaries in year 2. Also, community information centre programmes and FM radio programming is due to commence in year 2. In addition, an annual survey will be conducted to estimate the number of indirect beneficiaries trained/educated via community radio and FM radio programming.

title.narrative: Sustainable use of water and inputs
11abc) Number of food producers with effective use of inputs as a result of using the service(s) - Total

description.narrative:
Number of food producers with effective use of inputs as a result of using the service(s). At baseline level we can estimate the % of farmers using inputs effectively. We compare that to mid-line and endline values.
Defining 'effective use of inputs': for cocoa and oil palm there is a recommended number of applications to provide for optimal yield, which informs effective use of inputs.

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: The baseline results show that overall 11% of farmers effectively use inputs (fertilizer and pesticides). The baseline figure is therefore 11% of the targetted 45450

title.narrative: 12c) Improvement in effective use of fertilizer (%) as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project

description.narrative: Percentage of farmers that use fertilizer optimally. Effective use of fertilizer: Look at the frequency and quantity that the farmers apply fertilizer.

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: At baseline there is no improvement thus a figure of 0. However the baseline results show that 16% and 3% of oil palm and cocoa farmers applied fertilizer effectively. This will be tracked over the period to observe improvement

title.narrative: 12d) Improvement in effective use of pesticides (%) as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project

description.narrative: Percentage of farmers that use pesticides optimally. Effective use of pesticides: Look at the frequency and quantity that the farmers apply pesticides. The unit should be a total of both insecticide and fungiside.

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: At baseline there is no improvement thus a figure of 0. However the baseline results show that 0% and 23% of oil palm and cocoa farmers applied pesticides effectively. This will be tracked over the period to observe improvement

title.narrative: Sustainable access to quality and affordable financial services (MFIs)
17abc) Number of food producers with improved access to quality and affordable financial services - Total

description.narrative: Number of food producers with improved access to quality and affordable financial services Define access: as availability and affordability. The assumption is that when farmers have these 4 things (savings, loans, insurance and pensions), they will have improved access.

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: According to the baseline 2% of respondents had access to fiannce. Thus the baseline figure is 2% multiplied by the 45450 target.

title.narrative: 18) Percentage of loans applications approved

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: From the baseline only 22% of the respondents applied for a loan. All of those who applied for loans were successful, however 76% of the loans applied for received the full principal applied for.

title.narrative: Sustainable income security
14) Cocoa: Increase in income (%) for food producers as a result of the service provided within the project

description.narrative: % of income increase for cocoa food producers (farm income)

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: This cannot be estimated at baseline

title.narrative: 14) Oil palm: Increase in income (%) for food producers as a result of the service provided within the project

description.narrative: % of income increase for oil palm food producers (farm income)

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: This cannot be estimated at baseline

title.narrative: 13abc) Number of food producers with increased income as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project - Total

description.narrative:
Number of food producers with increased farm income
Calculate the farm income by an estimate based on the market price and farmer output (the kg of cocoa or oil palm produced on the farm)
What is increased? Farmers that observed farm incomes above baseline (compared to the baseline value of that farmer in case of the same sample, or the baseline average in case of a different sample).

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: This is the median income for cocoa and oilpalm farmers

title.narrative: Insurance & Pensions for farmers
15a) Number of food producers that is insured and/or has pensions by the service(s) provided within the project - Total

comment.narrative: 24-11-2020: The baseline results show that 5% of repondents were enrolled in any formal pension scheme. The figure is therefore 5% of the targeted 45,450.
